result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ben Richard Bosworth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to both charges   Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered case dismissed and read in.  Other in-court activity scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Ben Richard Bosworth not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for David Robles for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense has received an offer and needs time to review the offer with the defendant.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Ben Richard Bosworth not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations are still ongoing.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation. Case adjourned to Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court, defendant Ben Richard Bosworth not in court, in custody.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was set on the calendar for Branch 20 for Branch 22.  Case is continued before Branch 22 to accompany the lower-pending case (15CF1297) already set for 7/28/15 at 8:30 a.m. Email sent to ADA Robles.
Case was scheduled for a scheduling conference on 07/21/2015 at 8:30, however Branch 22 will be down that day.  Branch 20 will hear the matter for Branch 22.

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  (State requests a Scheduling Conference date other than July 28, 2015.)  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY ORDER.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney James T Moczydlowski.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Hearing proceeded.  Bail arguments made by the state and defense.  The Court sets bail at $250.00 CASH with TOT Justice Point for Supervision. Case adjourned to Preliminary Hearing Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant missed court on 06/11/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 06/17/2015 at 1:30pm, in Branch 22.  Parties notified.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defendant has been discharged due to bench warrant status.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney James T Moczydlowski in court.  Zachary Wittchow for David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant did appear this morning and was instructed to return this afternoon, as his Defense Counsel would not be present until the p.m. calendar due to a previously scheduled court appearance.
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Filed, Justic Point Pretrial & Violation Report dated 5/28/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Walmart

Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Ben Richard Bosworth in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2 on behalf of the Defendant with Attorney Mark Dluzak present in Court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
